persistence.fetchGlobalVisibilityErrorTitle: Failed to fetch app visibility settings
persistence.fetchGlobalVisibilityErrorMessage: Something has gone wrong. Please reload the page. If this occurs frequently, please contact us.
persistence.saveGlobalVisibilityErrorMessage: Something has gone wrong while trying to save. Reload the page and try again.
persistence.fetchProjectVisibilitiesErrorTitle: Failed to fetch project visibility settings
persistence.fetchProjectVisibilitiesErrorMessage: Something has gone wrong. Please reload the page. If this occurs frequently, please contact us.
persistence.addProjectVisibilityErrorMessage: Something has gone wrong while trying to save. Reload the page and try again.
persistence.changeProjectVisibilityErrorMessage: Something has gone wrong while trying to save. Reload the page and try again.
persistence.removeProjectVisibilityErrorMessage: Something has gone wrong while trying to reset the visibility for this project to default. Reload the page and try again.

visibilityOverviewScreen.heading: Activate features
visibilityOverviewScreen.headingDescription: Choose which features of Microsoft 365 for Jira should be active.
visibilityOverviewScreen.projectsDescription: Choose which features should be active or disabled in the specific project.
visibilityOverviewScreen.globalDescription: Enable features across all projects. Specific projects can be customized below.

productDescription.teams-cloud: Bring your Microsoft Teams conversations and chats to your Jira issues and vice versa.
productDescription.email-cloud: Create and update issues from your Outlook inbox. Connect emails to Jira issues and send emails from Jira.
productDescription.meetings-cloud: Schedule Microsoft Teams and Outlook meetings in Jira. See availabilities and send meeting requests from Jira.
productDescription.todo-cloud: Create and see personal To Dos in your Jira issues or sync all your Jira issues automatically.
productDescription.calendar-cloud: Add a configurable Outlook calendar to display Outlook and Jira events in Jira projects.
productDescription.teams-server: Bring your Microsoft Teams conversations and chats to your Jira issues and vice versa.
productDescription.email-server: Create and update issues from your Outlook inbox, using the powerful Outlook add-in.
productDescription.meetings-server: Schedule Microsoft Teams and Outlook meetings in Jira. See availabilities and send meeting requests from Jira.
productDescription.calendar-server: Add a configurable Outlook calendar to display Outlook and Jira events in Jira projects.

disableProductDescription.teams: You’re about to disable the Microsoft Teams feature for all projects by default. Project-specific settings won’t be affected by this choice.
disableProductDescription.email: You’re about to disable the email feature for all projects by default. Project-specific settings won’t be affected by this choice.
disableProductDescription.meetings: You’re about to disable the meetings feature for all projects by default. Project-specific settings won’t be affected by this choice.
disableProductDescription.todo: You’re about to disable the Microsoft To Do feature for all projects by default. Project-specific settings won’t be affected by this choice.
disableProductDescription.calendar: You’re about to disable the calendar feature for all projects by default. Project-specific settings won’t be affected by this choice.

enableProductDescription.teams: You’re about to enable the Microsoft Teams feature for all projects by default. Project-specific settings won’t be affected by this choice.
enableProductDescription.email: You’re about to enable the email feature for all projects by default. Project-specific settings won’t be affected by this choice.
enableProductDescription.meetings: You’re about to enable the meetings feature for all projects by default. Project-specific settings won’t be affected by this choice.
enableProductDescription.todo: You’re about to enable the Microsoft To Do feature for all projects by default. Project-specific settings won’t be affected by this choice.
enableProductDescription.calendar: You’re about to enable the calendar feature for all projects by default. Project-specific settings won’t be affected by this choice.

wizard.headline: Manage visibility
wizard.intro: Grant the visibility to the right projects, so that everybody can do their job in the best way.

help.documentationText: Find common questions, an installation guide or a feature overview in our support portal.
help.contactUsText: You need technical help or want a personal demo? Get in touch with us.
help.supportToolsText: Additional configurations, please only use in consultation with the support team.

gettingStarted.intro3: Connect Jira with your Microsoft 365 tools for seamless teamwork. Enable the functionality you need below.
gettingStarted.teamsInfo: Connect your Microsoft Teams conversations and chat to your Jira issues. Using Jira Service Management? Let customers create support tickets in Microsoft Teams.
gettingStarted.emailInfo: Create and update issues from your Outlook inbox and put emails in a Jira context. See whole email conversations in Jira and share, read or send emails right away.
gettingStarted.meetingsInfo: Schedule Microsoft Teams and Outlook meetings in your Jira issue: See availabilities of relevant users and send meeting requests directly in Jira.
gettingStarted.calendarInfo: Add a configurable Outlook calendar to display Outlook and Jira events in Jira projects.
gettingStarted.inValidLicenseText: You don't have a valid license or it has expired. If you'd like to continue using our app, please get a valid license!
gettingStarted.todoInfo: Sync all your Jira issues automatically with your chosen Microsoft To Do list and get a holistic overview of all your task.
gettingStarted.supportPortalText: You have a question? Or need help? We're happy to assist you.
gettingStarted.securityText: We ensure the highest security standard for your data.

adminConnectivityScreen.heading: Connection settings
adminConnectivityScreen.connectivityHelpText: If you change the existing public URL of your system, please proceed with caution. All users will be logged out of the app. In addition, existing chats or emails links might not show up anymore. Please reach out to our support if you are unsure (contact@yasoon.com).
adminConnectivityScreen.staticIPHelpText: If you need to allow IPs in your firewall, please check out our {link1}
adminConnectivityScreen.jiraUrlHelpText: This is the publicly reachable URL of your Jira instance
adminConnectivityScreen.registerInstanceErrorTitle: Error trying to reach yasoon backend. See connectivity check
adminConnectivityScreen.connectDescription: During the installation of the app, we tried to register the instance with our cloud infrastructure, which unfortunately failed. Please make sure that the Jira instance can reach yasoon services and Microsoft 365.
adminConnectivityScreen.connectedDescription: We were able to successfully establish a secure connection to the yasoon services. If you experience unexpected connectivity issues you can perform a connectivity check below.
adminConnectivityScreen.yasoonConnectivityDescription: As the app deeply integrates with Microsoft 365, which is a cloud only solution, our app behaves a bit differently than “classic” Jira Server apps. Your Jira instance needs to connect to yasoon services as well as to Microsoft 365. {link1}
adminConnectivityScreen.staticIPHelpText2: To use the app, your Jira system needs to be reachable by our servers. If your system is behind a firewall, you can allow access for the following IPs - all requests will come from these IPs.
adminConnectivityScreen.baseUrlMismatchBanner: Your Jira URL does not match the configured one below
adminConnectivityScreen.baseUrlMismatch: This might be intentional if e.g., you cloned your instance. Please adjust the URL below.
adminConnectivityScreen.noBaseUrlInSettings: Connection to yasoon not possible. Please connect the public reachable Jira URL. And do a connectivity-check afterwards to see if everything works as intended

secretRotation.heading: Secret rotation
secretRotation.description: The app stores a shared secret to ensure a secure connection with our services. All Jira admins may have access to this secret. To avoid any malicious and unauthorized data access, we recommend rotating the secret whenever you remove an admin from your instance

connectivityCheck.heading: Connection settings overview
connectivityCheck.connectivityCheckDescription: Support tool to check and troubleshoot the connection to mandatory services. Only for analysis purposes, this won’t change any configuration.
connectivityCheck.introductionText: Your data center/server environment needs to reach and needs to be reachable from our servers. On this page, you can check, if your system does fulfill all our requirements to work properly.

projectActivateFeaturesScreen.heading: Activate features
projectActivateFeaturesScreen.headingDescription: Choose which features of Microsoft 365 for Jira should be active in this project.
projectActivateFeaturesScreen.noProjectAdminEmptyState: You need project admin permissions to view this page.

adminSupportScreen.description: This are support features, please only use in consultation with the support team.
adminSupportScreen.loadPropertyFailedMessage: Something has gone wrong while trying to load. Reload the page and try again.
adminSupportScreen.savePropertyFailedMessage: Something has gone wrong while trying to save. Reload the page and try again.

createChatScreen.withoutIssueContext: Allow the action to run without a Jira issue context.

chatAccess.chooseChatPermissions: Choose who should be able to view this chat in Jira
chatAccess.onlyMembersChat: Only members of the chat can view it in Jira
chatAccess.contextChatAccess: Users with issue access can view chat messages
chatAccess.contextChatAllowJoining: Users with issue access can view and join the chat

channelSelect.noChannelSelectOptions: No channels found. You can only find channels which have 'Smart Connect for Jira' installed.
channelSelect.privateChannelNotSupported: Private channels are not supported currently
channelSelect.appNotInstalledInTeam: The app is not installed in this team yet.

officeLoginScreen.heading: Welcome to Microsoft 365 automations
officeLoginScreen.description: Looks like you're using the app for the very first time. Please log in with your Microsoft 365 account to get started!

actionSuccess.description: The action with the name {{name}} has been created successfully. You can already copy the webhook url to the Jira Automation. Please note that the action needs to be authorized by the desired Microsoft user (this might be the administrator).
